summary: Project with multiple task management features (To-Dos, Timelines, Follow-Ups, Deadlines, Compliance Tasks) requiring status management functionality.

existing_features.title: In the ClientTasksTab component, add the same inline status-change controls for each task type (To-Dos, Timelines, Follow-Ups, Deadlines) in the respective tab tables, so clients can update task statuses from the client portal as well. Reuse or share the status select logic from MyComplianceTasksSection to keep behavior consistent.

new_feature_requests.summary: Provide a way to change the status of tasks (To-Dos, Timelines, Follow-Ups, Deadlines, Compliance Tasks)

In the MyComplianceTasksSection component, add inline status-change controls (select dropdowns or segmented buttons) for each task type — To-Dos, Timelines, Follow-Ups, and Deadlines — so that clients can update the status of their own tasks directly from the compliance dashboard. Each control should reflect the current status and immediately call the appropriate mutation hook on change (e.g., useUpdateClientToDoStatus, useUpdateClientTimelineStatus, useUpdateClientFollowUpStatus, useUpdateClientDeadlineStatus or equivalent hooks). Show a toast notification on success or failure.

Ensure the backend actor exposes update-status endpoints for all four client task types (clientToDo, clientTimeline, clientFollowUp, clientDeadline) if they do not already exist. Each endpoint should accept the task ID and new status, verify the caller owns the record, and persist the updated status. Add or extend the corresponding frontend mutation hooks (e.g., in useComplianceAdmin.ts or a dedicated client-task hooks file) to call these endpoints.
